It's about balance and not about singling out one food group as the sole cause of disease. In fact, many national dietary guidelines recommend including lean cuts of red meat in a balanced diet as part of a healthy eating pattern.

So, to sum up, the science does not support the idea that eating red meat in moderation significantly increases cancer risk. What matters most is the overall quality of the diet and lifestyle choices.
